speaker: SCULLY
line: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. It has been six years since my last confession, and since then I've drifted away from the church. I'm not sure why exactly.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Have you come to confess?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, um, there's a man that I work with - a friend - and usually I'm able to discuss these things with him... but not this. Father, do you believe in miracles?

speaker: PRIEST
line: Of course, I see them every day... the rising sun, the birth of a child...

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm talking about events that defy explanation. Things that... I believe helped me to save a young boy's life. But now I wonder if I saw them at all. If I didn't just imagine them.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Why do you doubt yourself?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because my partner didn't see them. He didn't... he didn't believe them. And usually he... he believes without question.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Maybe they weren't meant for him to see. Maybe they were only meant for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that possible?

speaker: PRIEST
line: With the Lord, anything is possible. Perhaps you saw these things because you needed to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: To find my way back?

speaker: PRIEST
line: Sometimes we must come full circle to find the truth. Why does that surprise you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mostly, it just makes me afraid.

speaker: PRIEST
line: Afraid?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Afraid that God is speaking... but that no one's listening.
